thread.title: Sensex Ends Flat As Investors Remain Cautious Over Greece Referendum
thread.title_full: Sensex Ends Flat As Investors Remain Cautious Over Greece Referendum

title: Sensex Ends Flat As Investors Remain Cautious Over Greece Referendum
text:
Nifty 8,444.90 -8.15 [-0.10%] Auto shares were the star performers in trade after June figures were largely buoyant. Mahindra and Mahindra, Bajaj Auto and Hero Motor Corp were the winners from the space.
Tata Motors, Hindalco, Vedanta, HDFC Bank, Coal India were among the shares that dragged the Nifty down. 
Shares in Shrenuj and Companies rallied a huge 10 per cent after reports that the company had won orders worth $30 million for its jewellery. 
Banking shares apart from HDFC Bank had a good session in trade. Leading the set of gainers were Kotak Mahindra and Axis Bank. 
IT Stocks had a mixed session with Infosys and TCS declining, while Wipro and HCL Tech gained ground. 
Stock from the jewellery segment continued to gain ground with Rajesh Exports and P C Jewellers among the gainers. 
Shares with links to the agriculture sector rose after the government emphasised on an increased outlay for the sector. Jain Irrigation and Monsanto were among the gainers. 
Meanwhile, most of the Asian markets ended the day higher, except the Shanghai Composite, which fell a huge 3 per cent in trade.
